HelpTexts.Text: Any static string you configure, do not enclose in quoatation marks
A country from the Countries.txt file. Will get the N:th country from the file for each generation.
A female name from the FemaleNames.txt file. Will get the N:th name from the file for each generation.
A country from the MaleNames.txt file. Will get the N:th name from the file for each generation.
A country from the Cities.txt file. Will get the N:th city from the file for each generation.
A country from the UserNames.txt file. Will get the N:th username from the file for each generation.
Current date of your computer. You can shift the created date by the parameters. For example: To insert a row for tomorrow simply shift 1 day.
Static date you configure, do not enclose in quatation marks
Use GetDate() function for this column.
A randomly generated date
startdate + N seconds
startdate + N milliseconds
startdate + N minutes
startdate + N hours
startdate + N days
A random decimal within the limits of the configuration.
Decimal number counting up using N.
Any sql query you wish to use.
Will simply use NULL as value for this column.
Select a column to use the same value as it generated. The other column must be higher up in the Execution Item List (ie it must have generated it's value before this generator runs).
Random foreign key from the FK-Cache. Will not include rows inserted after the analyzes of the DB.
The N:th foreign key from the FK-Cache. Will not include rows inserted after the analyzes of the DB.
A randomly generated integer within the configured limits.
N, starting from the min value up to the max value and back to the min value.
Will use the Identity value inserted by another item. Select the Item number that you wish to get identify from.
Any static number you configure.
Random integers (Normally distributed).
Random integers (Exponential).
Random integers (Weibull).
Random integers (Laplace).
Random GUID, generated from .Net.
Static GUID that you configure, do not enclose in qoutation marks.
Random bit genration, 0 or 1 randomly
Static binary value
Simple XML generator
This column is IDENTITY and will get it's value generated automatically by SQL Server
Inserted Identity will have N as value.
